channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lights on poole court not working, 8th October
item.description:
Lights on the stairwell and outside flats on poole court are not working - they were fixed earlier this year and are now not working. It's dangerous as it presents a trip hazard and safety issues as you can't see who is on the stairs.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Peters Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffitti, 8th October
item.description:
My house backs onto the tennis courts in Arnos Park. The council's fence which runs along the back of my garden has graffitti on it. My house is 47 Brookdale.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Southgate, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti (Offensive or up to 2 meters off the ground)

item.title: Street light broken, 8th October
item.description:
The street light on the block of 37 Smith Square is broken. Not only does it not work, the pole is about 1/3 the size it should be. Someone took down this street light, and at night it is very dark and feels unsafe for those who live on that block.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Smith Square, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins still on the street, 8th October
item.description:
As reported on a numerous occasions but still nothing done the bins are still on the street and as you can see by the photograph at 5 in the morning when I pass they cannot be seen. They pose a hazard. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Lane, Crayford, London

item.title: Badly positioned row of three recycling bins in Rectory Rd, Beckenham about 2m west of the High St traffic lights., 8th October
item.description:
Badly positioned row of three recycling bins in Rectory Rd, Beckenham about 2m west of the High St traffic lights. The bins are positioned about 10cm from the kerb edge exactly where cyclists need to either position themselves, resting a foot on the kerb, and also creating an escape hazard fo cyclists when a long vehicle pulls up there too. Please reposition the row of 3 bins - there is plenty of other, non-critical space nearby.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Rectory Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No entry Sign missing, no right turn sign missing - multiple vehicles turning into the one way street, 8th October
item.description:
Multiple vehicles are turning into the one-way street from the wrong direction heading into oncoming traffic. Also, residents pulling out from garages & parking spaces have a blind spot when these vehicles are making this illegal manoeuvre and having near misses. It won’t be long before there will be an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Blackburne's Mews, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear sir madam sorry to hear your car has been clothed just want to give you an update Irish travellers love stealing Toyota cars it is one of their favorites to nick. This is because it is a number one seller in Ireland which they ship stolen cars to. They also cloned the vehicle so the authority do not know the vehicle is stolen for transport.Yes, the Toyota Corolla is a famous and best-selling car in Ireland, frequently appearing in the top positions for new car sales, with the Corolla Cross also being a leading model in recent months. The Corolla is celebrated for its value and reliability, becoming a popular choice for Irish motorists., 8th October

item.title: As well as the rotated width restriction sign, (recently reported) the low bridge sign is also even more rotated away from facing oncoming traffic - sign fronting 8, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands (nr jct Mays Hill Rd) has rotated nearly 80 degrees., 8th October
item.description:
As well as the rotated width restriction sign, (recently reported) the low bridge sign is also even more rotated away from facing oncoming traffic - sign fronting 8, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands (nr jct Mays Hill Rd) has rotated nearly 80 degrees. It has now for about the 5th time in 3 years, please find a permanent solution. Eg. drill a pair of bolts through the sign into the pole. Whateveter is there now, eg. jubilee clips, are not holding the large sign in place on the single pole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a rat infestation in the bin area of kings Garth (also known as Princes Garth), 8th October
item.description:
The bin store is infested with rats which are frequently seen in the area even on the day time. The smell is appalling and general fly tipping is not helping the situation. The estate is managed by L&Q I believe and although I have contacted them directly I have yet to receive a reply.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Taymount Rise, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Endless endless litter, only getting worse, 8th October
item.description:
The path that runs from Kidbrooke Way through to Kidbrooke Station round the back of Aldi is becoming one of the most disgusting places to walk. I go down there most mornings for work and it seems to be a magnet for litter. There are all your classics, crushed cans, used food boxes, crisp wrappers, but perhaps more concerningly is blue rubble sacks of rubbish, what look like large collections of boxes being dumped there, wrapping plastic, polystyrene boxes. It goes on and on and on and it seems to be getting worse - literally by the day. Someone is hanging dog poo bags on the same rogue nail on a broken fence post. While I respect that this could be a legitimate attempt at making an artistic statement on the state of the world, it's not all that pleasant to walk past. There is not a single bin down the path, which obviously makes the issue worse, but concerningly, it seems that the area is not covered by street cleaning teams whatsoever. Can we please get this seen to? Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 241, Kidbrooke Park Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Updates Dear sir madam. I am truly sorry to hear that somebody has cloned your vehicle. You have done the right thing by reporting it to the police for whatever good it is. Metropolitan safer neighbourhood are quite lazy in hackney. Police officers have more time to sit on public park benches instead of investigate any crimes. This is a very common offence cloning vehicles going on in Hackney you have Irish travellers who still cars all the time, clone vehicles for all kinds of purposes. To park illegally. To get free petrol. To get free tax,To get free MOT free insurance. To hide stolen vehicles identity. To evade police detection AMPR. Hackney Council also our very lazy and incompetent in dealing with these reports. You would think your local authority would work together to put a stop to this criminal behavior in the borough of Hackney. The mayor has more time for Hackney Central and making loads of cycle routes then tackling antisocial behavior. Parking fine. Reported via mobile in the Illegal Parking category anonymously at 12:09, Thursday 15 May 2025 Sent to Hackney Council 40 minutes later. FixMyStreet ref: 7573685. Hi, I keep receiving parking fines on my car (reg: FM07LFK) I don't even live in Hackney, I have reported to the police that I believe my number plate has been clonned, (ref: cad 3150) Could you please get to me regarding this issue and how do I resolve, 8th October
item.description:
